attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent I strongly oppose raising of the fees by USCIS. Frankly
they have raised them several times since I first pursued our sons adoption in
2002/03. My son is a US Citizen by the law but because he came to this country
in August 2003 I have to file for his Certificate of Citizenship now about $215 which
is I believe more than doubling in cost. This would have been given to us as of
right had our son entered this country after January 2004 so now raising the fee is
frankly adding insult to injury. Also, many people that are or have immigrated to
this country are poor and can barely afford the fees as it is. Raising them is an
impediment to their legalization and goes against what I always thought this
country stood for.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Robin Senator
